Authors: Diogo R.S. Pereira, Alan J.L. Phillips
Title:
A new leaf spot disease of Chamaerops humilis caused by
Palmeiramyces chamaeropicola gen. et sp. nov.
Keywords:
Fungus, new genus, new species, palm tree, plant
pathogen
Abstract:
In September 2018, a leaf spot disease was noticed on an
European fan palm (Chamaerops humilis L.) in Oeiras, Portugal. The aim
of this study was to identify and characterize the causative agent of
this symptom. Morphological characters and phylogenetic data derived
from ITS and LSU sequences revealed that this leaf spot was caused by a
filamentous fungus that fits well within the order Capnodiales and the
family Teratosphaeriaceae. Therefore, it is here introduced as a new
genus and new species, Palmeiramyces chamaeropicola D.R.P. Pereira &
A.J.L. Phillips. Furthermore, a new leaf disease is reported on
Chamaerops humilis.
